ACT
43
Designation of heirs
The testator can designate one or more heirs in his will.
An heir based on a will is a person designated by the testator to inherit him in whole or in a proportional part.
A person to whom one or more specific things or rights were left by will will also be considered an heir, if it is established that the testator's will was for that person to be his heir.
